title.narrative: Revitalization of primary health care services in Aleppo and Daraa

description.narrative: The project main aim is to save lives and alleviate the suffering of people in rural Aleppo and rural Daraa through ensuring their access to the package of primary health care services in primary health care facilities. The project will target four MoH public primary health care facilities in rural Daraa and rural Aleppo with rehabilitation work and medical equipment. The areas targeted are: Tall Ed-Daman, Rasm Haram El-Emam in rural Aleppo, and Nawa and Tassil in rural Daraa. The targeted areas were evaluated as in severe need based on the severity scale in which there are around 60,000 people are in need. The actual coverage at the sub district level of the four PHC facilities is 248,000 individuals. Tall Ed-Daman covers Tal Ed-Daman sub-district and About Al Dohour sub-district in Idleb. It is expected that this area will receive influxes in case of any emergency in Idleb. Rasm Haram El-Imam has catchment area in east rural Aleppo that extends to eastern kweires. Both covers a population of 173000. Nawa town covers around 55,000 people in Nawa sub-district, while Tassil covers around 20,000, making the total coverage of 75,000. The areas are witnessing increased number of IDPs returning to their original homes. The rehabilitated primary health care facilities will provide the package of PHC services that include: child health programs (vaccination, promotion, and integrated management of childhood diseases), reproductive health services ( pre and post-natal care, family planning, referral to obstetric services), non-communicable diseases management, health education, communicable diseases management, oral health and dental services and nutrition. Medicine provision will be part of the services, as in any other Public PHC facility. Each of the PHC is expected to receive an average of 3000 individuals monthly. MoH /DoH will ensure the staffing and the running of the PHCs once rehabilitated. UNHCR partnership with professional partners experienced in rehabilitation of health facilities will ensure smooth high quality rehabilitation that can support the services on the longer term. Coordination with WHO, UNICEF and UNFPA for capacity building of the health professionals will enhance the performance of the health facilities in addressing the needs of the population in the target areas.
